alert.note: Alert for Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued October 24 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast New York, including the following county, Suffolk. * WHEN...Until 500 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 300 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain moving into the advisory area. Minor flooding is expected to begin shortly. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 1.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Centereach, Medford, Ronkonkoma, Patchogue, Middle Island, Port Jefferson, Coram, Holbrook, Sayville, Farmingville, Rocky Point, Mount Sinai, Yaphank, East Patchogue, Lake Ronkonkoma, Selden, Holtsville, Setauket, Miller Place and North Bellport. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
